column4: Hello. I recently upgraded Ubuntu 10.04 to 10.10. Now i have a lot of boot enteries in the grub2 boot loader and when i boit some kernels the PC freezes after some minutes.. can i remove the old kernels? If yes, how. Thanx.
use your favourite software manager to remove them
Can I use synaptic package manager? Can it damage my system...?
yes you can use synaptic, and no it will not damage your system, if you only remove old kernels
Oh okay thanks for yer help.
in synaptic do a "quicksearch" for linux-image, then remove the oldest entries
it also created a second entery for windows 7 how can i remove this one?
not sure here, sorry
okay i think ill manage to edit the grub config file but thank you for your help with the kernels.
you're welcome :-) do you have grub1 or grub2?
grub2
Oh nevermind about the Windows 7 thing i found this app called Grub customizer to edit the enteries of grub2 or BURG... i think that worked.
then editing /boot/grub/grub.conf  is not really adviseable; changes are made to /etc/default/grub

Thanks anyway.

in my experience not, but you see opinions differ - in any case you should back up your data first
